Title: Veterinary Surgeon - Small Animal
RoleDescription: Find your futureAt Glenbrae Veterinary Clinic in Bearsden, we are looking for a compassionate and dedicated Veterinary Surgeon to join our team and deliver exceptional clinical care to our patients. As a valued member of our team, you will play a key role in providing high-quality care while supporting the wider veterinary team.Your day-to-day responsibilities will involve managing a varied caseload, spanning both medical and surgical cases. We are seeking an experienced and enthusiastic individual, passionate about supporting the growth and development of our younger team members. If you're someone who thrives in a collaborative environment and is confident working within a smaller team, including some sole charge at our branch clinics, we would love to hear from you.Fix or FlexWere passionate about supporting our teams well-being, which is why we offer flexible rota patterns and working hours designed to suit your lifestylewhether you're looking for full or part-time work, or are at any stage in your veterinary career.We can offer up to 38 hours per week, but were equally happy to accommodate part-time arrangements. Our weekday shifts typically run from 8:30am to 8:00pm on Mondays, and 8:30am to 7:00pm Tuesday to Friday. Our Saturday rota is just 1 in 3, with time off during the week to ensure a fair balance.Want to know more about Glenbrae Vets?  Glenbrae has been established since 1990 and we are a busy 3-site practice with Tier 2 RCVS accreditation. We became part of the IVC Evidensia family in 2019 which has helped us by providing many opportunities for clinical excellence and development within our teams.  Our mission is to provide outstanding conventional and holistic care from a local friendly and caring team. Our services include laparoscopy, dental radiography, ultrasonography including specialist input, endoscopy, digital radiography, laser therapy and acupuncture, stem cell therapy and a consultancy homeopathic service. Meet our team!  We are a forward thinking, proactive team who care about our clients, patients, and each other. We actively promote a healthy mindset and wellbeing giving each other support both professionally and personally. Our clinics are situated in Bearsden, Dumbarton and Muirhead allowing us to serve a large area of clients. We are a team of 29, made up of 10 vets, 5 RVNs, 2 SVNs and 8 CCA's and other admin support staff. We have a visiting homeopathic consultant and peripatetic ultrasonographer. We currently have multiple vets who either hold or who are working towards post-graduate qualifications.  This investment not only supports our vets development but also provides us with additional expertise within our clinics. Title: Veterinary Internship - Surgery
RoleDescription: We are proud to announce that we are now inviting applications for two Small Animal Surgery Interns. This role is the perfect opportunity to collaborate with experienced Surgical Diplomats and expand your skills, knowledge, and experience. This internship would be best suited to someone looking to pursue a Surgical Residency in the near future. The Hospital Hamilton Specialist Referrals is a purpose built state-of-the-art veterinary hospital which provides the latest in cutting edge, specialist treatments for cats and dogs, supported by an exceptional rehabilitation and physiotherapy facility. Located in modern facilities, we are based in High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, within easy reach of London, Oxford, the Chilterns, and Cotswolds. The hospital is five minutes from the M40 and located near major airports. We deliver world-class clinical services, with a clear focus on recruiting the people that make that a reality. Hamilton Specialist Referrals was born of the belief that there is room for a new wave of veterinary excellence across the UK. Unparalleled clinical care, delivered in a friendly and supportive manner to referring vets, is paramount to the team. The hospital is operational 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and facilities include on-site 1.5T MRI and CT scanner suites, a variety of joint replacement systems, electrodiagnostics, and a full complement of the latest radiography and arthroscopy equipment.Focus On Your FutureInterns are encouraged to openly engage in case discussions with senior supervising clinicians, residents, and the senior nursing team, and should contribute to a positive, informative, respectful, and inclusive environment for all. Attention to detail, particularly in maintaining accurate records and written correspondence, is also a key component of this role. The internship runs for 12 months and covers varying shifts to suit the needs of the hospital, including 1:4 weekends cover for Neurology and HDU services, and occasional OOH work. Teaching is an essential component, with interns expected to participate in scheduled didactic seminars and lectures, M+M rounds, and weekly journal clubs and radiology rounds. Interns will work with their supervising clinician to participate effectively in all aspects of planning, diagnosis and treatment of cases. Animal welfare and the ethics of interventions must be considered by balancing practical and financial factors when determining appropriate patient care. Therefore, the ability to apply prior knowledge and experience to maintain the high clinical standards expected within our hospital is essential. Interns will openly engage in case discussions with the senior supervising clinicians, residents and senior nursing team and should contribute to a positive, informative, respectful, and inclusive environment for all. Attention to detail, particularly with maintaining accurate records and written correspondence is also a key component of this role. Prior rotating internship experience, the ability to work independently as well as under supervision, excellent communication, and interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to multi-task with a flexible approach to working are essential.Because Our Employees MatterWe recognise that our people are fundamental to the success of our business. Investing in our people, premises and processes is at the heart of what we do. Title: Registered Veterinary Nurse - Small Animal (12 Month Fixed Term)
RoleDescription: Were excited to offer a fantastic opportunity for a Registered Veterinary Nurse to join our friendly and supportive team at our purpose-built practice in Sale, on a temporary basis for 12 Months.Your New RoleAs a Registered Veterinary Nurse, you will play an essential role in supporting our veterinary team in a range of clinical tasks, including assisting with various surgical procedures, promoting dental care, and providing consultations for health checks and general care. You will be responsible for running nurse clinics, offering services such as weight management, laser therapy, and more. The role offers a variety of surgical procedures, so you will have the chance to develop your skills in different aspects of veterinary care. Our PracticeSale is a purpose-built practice with excellent facilities, including 4 consult rooms, separate cat and dog wards, an isolation ward and digital x-ray, dental x-ray, ultrasound, and brand-new laparoscopic equipmentWe are a training practice, so if youre interested in becoming a clinical coach, well support your development. Weve also earned the IVC Evidensia Patient Safety Award and are an ISFM Cat Friendly Clinic. Additionally, one of our nurses has a special interest in behaviour and further training, and were eager to develop this service at the clinic level.Whats the Team Like?The team at Sale is hard-working, but we always make time to enjoy ourselves! We hold regular funded team days out, such as escape rooms, kayaking, axe throwing, and crazy golf.
